controllers

Class LoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.LoginController

  • @PUBLICAPI
public class LoginController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be used as a login controller. Each login controller will remember what user they have logged in.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LoginController(HospitalIN hospital)
      Default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginController

        @PUBLICAPI
public LoginController(HospitalIN hospital)
        Default constructor. Initialises a new login controller.
        Parameters:
        hospital - The hospital where this login controller is for.
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidHospitalException - If the given hospital is invalid for any reason.
        See Also:
        HospitalController

    • Method Detail

      • getAllUsers

        @PUBLICAPI
public java.util.Collection<UserIN> getAllUsers()
        Returns:
        A collection of all users that are currently registered in the system.

      • getSpecificNurse

        @PUBLICAPI
public NurseIN getSpecificNurse(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a specific nurse that works in this hospital.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the nurse you're trying to find.
        Returns:
        The given nurse, or null if there is no such user.

      • getSpecificDoctor

        @PUBLICAPI
public DoctorIN getSpecificDoctor(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a specific doctor that works in this hospital.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the doctor you're trying to find.
        Returns:
        The given doctor, or null if there is no such user.

      • logIn

        @PUBLICAPI
public void logIn(UserIN user,
                   CampusIN at)
        This method will log in the given user at the given location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given user or campus are null.

      • loggedIn

        @PUBLICAPI
public boolean loggedIn()
        Returns:
        True if the user of this controller is logged in.

      • getUserIN

        @PUBLICAPI
public UserIN getUserIN()
        Returns:
        The user who has been granted access to log on.

      • getLocations

        @PUBLICAPI
public java.util.Collection<CampusIN> getLocations()
        Returns:
        All locations in this hospital.

      • getLocation

        @PUBLICAPI
public CampusIN getLocation()
        Returns:
        The place where the user of this login controller is at.
